com.netflix.genie.common.client

Class BaseGenieClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.genie.common.client.BaseGenieClient

  • public class BaseGenieClient
extends java.lang.Object
    REST client class that is extended to implement specific clients.

    • Method Detail

      • executeRequest

        public <C extends java.util.Collection> java.lang.Object executeRequest(com.netflix.client.http.HttpRequest request,
                                                                        java.lang.Class<C> collectionClass,
                                                                        java.lang.Class entityClass)
                                                                 throws GenieException
        Execute a HTTP request.
        Type Parameters:
        C - The collection class if a collection is the expected response entity.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to send. Not null.
        collectionClass - The collection class. Null if none expected.
        entityClass - The entity class. Not null.
        Returns:
        The response entity.
        Throws:
        GenieException - On any error.

      • buildRequest

        public static com.netflix.client.http.HttpRequest buildRequest(com.netflix.client.http.HttpRequest.Verb verb,
                                                               java.lang.String requestUri,
                                                               com.google.common.collect.Multimap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                                                               java.lang.Object entity)
                                                        throws GenieException
        Build a HTTP request from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        verb - The type of HTTP request to use. Not null.
        requestUri - The URI to send the request to. Not null/empty/blank.
        params - Any query parameters to send along with the request.
        entity - An entity. Required for POST or PUT.
        Returns:
        The HTTP request.
        Throws:
        GenieException - On any error.

      • initEureka

        public static void initEureka(java.lang.String env)
        Initializes Eureka for the given environment, if it is being used - should only be used if the user of library hasn't initialized Eureka already.
        Parameters:
        env - "prod" or "test" or "dev"
